title: Bill Belichick reflects on ‘learning curve’ during first season coaching college football
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick experiences a learning curve in his first season coaching UNC football, with the team currently 4-5.
Belichick reflects on his coaching adjustments, citing room for improvement in player positioning and strategy.
UNC must win two of the remaining three games to match last year's 6-win season and potentially qualify for a bowl.

title: Patriots have 15 players land on injury report, but get some good news
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots face injury challenges with 15 players, including key figures like Christian Barmore and Marcus Jones, on the list.
Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson show improvement, limited participants on Monday after missing Sunday's game.
New England prepares for Jets game on a short week, focusing on recovery and readiness for Thursday night's matchup.

title: Georgia man allegedly stole millions in unclaimed Mass. property
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Shaka Stayman, 44, of Atlanta, faces 25 counts for allegedly stealing $1.1 million in unclaimed Massachusetts property.
Investigators say Stayman filed falsified claims, targeting deceased individuals’ funds held by Massachusetts' unclaimed property division.
Stayman's co-defendant, Dwight Tucker, will be arraigned Thursday amid Stayman's $2 million cash bail and pending federal sentencing.

title: TreVeyon Henderson explained why he looked at the sideline during key TD run
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson looked to the sideline for guidance during a crucial touchdown run late in the game.
Henderson's fourth-quarter touchdown secured the Patriots' win despite Tampa Bay scoring shortly after.
Rookie TreVeyon Henderson had a career-best performance, gaining over 100 yards and scoring multiple touchdowns.

title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei returned to the Bruins lineup after a five-game benching, contributing two assists in a win against Toronto.
Lohrei's benching followed defensive struggles, with head coach Marco Sturm benching him during a Bruins five-game winning streak.
Several Bruins, including Lohrei, have responded positively to Sturm's benching strategy, improving performance upon returning to the lineup.

title: Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Petitioners aiming to repeal legal marijuana in Massachusetts face accusations of misleading voters about their ballot initiative.
The Secretary of the Commonwealth's Office received complaints voters signed petitions without understanding them, sparking concern over misrepresentation.
Massachusetts Cannabis Business Association alleges signature gatherers commit 'organized voter fraud' by misinforming citizens about the petition's content.

title: Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 — UMass system dominates
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts state payroll reached $9.19 billion in 2025, a decrease from last year's $10.26 billion.
UMass system led with top 15 highest-paid employees, including Coach Frank Martin at $1.95 million.
MBTA had the second-highest payroll at $799.68 million, followed by the Trial Court at $574.67 million.

title: Mass. State Police: 56 arrested in three-day child exploitation sweep
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police arrested 56 people in a three-day operation targeting child exploitation and abuse material.
Operation Firewall resulted in the seizure of 229 electronic devices and execution of 34 residential search warrants.
Suspects' charges include possession of child pornography and attempts to arrange sex with minors online.

title: 5 ways to help fight food insecurity in the North Shore right now
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: La Colaborativa's food pantry in Chelsea assists residents through volunteer efforts and donations.
Beverly Bootstraps food pantry calls for volunteers to build snack bags for local children in need.
Lynn Community Fridge, open 24/7, welcomes food donations with oversight by the Lynn Family Resource Center.

title: SNAP fully funded, Healey says, as she urges residents to use benefits
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: SNAP benefits in Massachusetts are fully funded, Governor Maura Healey announced Monday amid federal disputes.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell secured a federal court order blocking cuts to previously issued SNAP benefits.
A fund by Healey and United Way raised over $5 million for food pantries during SNAP funding uncertainties.
